stem: Given question: A cat can't talk, but a cat can what? and answer: meow, explain why in
no_more_50_words: A cat can meow as a way to vocalize.
100_to_150_words: A cat meowing is the most common form of communication between cats and their owners. Cats have a range of vocalizations they use to communicate with other cats, humans, and other animals. Cats meow to express a variety of emotions, including hunger, fear, loneliness, happiness, and anger. They also meow to communicate a need for attention, such as when they want to be petted or want to be fed. Cats may also meow to greet their owners when they come home. Cats meow to communicate a variety of needs and emotions, and this is why cats can't talk but can meow.
